etymologies: mid 19th century: from Greek isometria ‘equality of measure’ (from isos ‘equal’ + -metria ‘measuring’) + -ic

definitions: relating to or denoting muscular action in which tension is developed without contraction of the muscle.
shortDefinitions: relating to type of muscular action

definitions: (in technical or architectural drawing) incorporating a method of showing projection or perspective in which the three principal dimensions are represented by three axes 120° apart.
shortDefinitions: referring to type of technical drawing

definitions: (of a transformation) without change of shape or size.
shortDefinitions: referring to transformation without change of shape or size
